alert.note: Alert for Buckeye, Avondale; Tonopah Desert (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 6:13AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa County through 645 AM MST... At 613 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Palo Verde Nuclear Generation Station, or 8 miles southeast of Tonopah, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Buckeye, Palo Verde Nuclear Generation Station, Wintersburg and Hassayampa. This includes AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 96 and 112. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
